009package imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012import static java.lang.Math.PI;
013import static java.lang.Math.cos;
014import static java.lang.Math.sin;
015import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
016
017import java.awt.Shape;
018import java.awt.geom.AffineTransform;
019import java.awt.geom.Ellipse2D;
020import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
021import java.util.Locale;
022
023import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Curve2d;
024import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
025import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.project.OrthogonalEllipseProjector;
026import imagingbook.common.geometry.shape.ShapeProducer;
027import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
028
029
030/**
031 * Represents an ellipse shape with 
032 * major axis length ra, minor axis length rb, center point (xc, yc),
033 * and orientation theta. Instances are immutable.
034 * 
035 * @author WB
036 *
037 */
038public class GeometricEllipse implements ShapeProducer, Curve2d {
039        
040        public final double ra, rb, xc, yc, theta;      // TODO: make private!
041        private final OrthogonalEllipseProjector projector;
042        
043        /**
044         * Constructor.
045         * Axis lengths may be exchanged to ensure ra &ge; rb.
046         * 
047         * @param ra major axis length
048         * @param rb minor axis length
049         * @param xc center point (x)
050         * @param yc center point (y)
051         * @param theta orientation
052         */
053        public GeometricEllipse(double ra, double rb, double xc, double yc, double theta) {
054                this.xc = xc;
055                this.yc = yc;
056                if (ra >= rb) { // make sure ra is always the longer axis!
057                        this.ra = ra;
058                        this.rb = rb;
059                        this.theta = Arithmetic.mod(theta, PI); // theta = 0,...,pi always
060                }
061                else {
062                        this.ra = rb; // swap ra/rb
063                        this.rb = ra;
064                        this.theta = Arithmetic.mod(theta + PI/2, PI);  // theta = 0,...,pi always
065                }
066                this.projector = new OrthogonalEllipseProjector(this);
067                
068                if (this.ra < this.rb) {
069                        throw new RuntimeException(this.toString());
070                }
071        }
072        
073        /**
074         * Constructor, short version for axis-aligned ellipses.
075         * @param ra major axis length
076         * @param rb minor axis length
077         * @param xc center point (x)
078         * @param yc center point (y)
079         */
080        public GeometricEllipse(double ra, double rb, double xc, double yc) {
081                this(ra, rb, xc, yc, 0.0);
082        }
083        
084        /**
085         * Constructor.
086         * @param p parameter vector [ra, rb, xc, yc, theta].
087         * @see #getParameters()
088         */
089        public GeometricEllipse(double[] p) {
090                this(p[0], p[1], p[2], p[3], p[4]);
091        }
092        
093        /**
094         * Constructor.
095         * Creates a new {@link GeometricEllipse} from a {@link AlgebraicEllipse} instance.
096         * @param ae a {@link AlgebraicEllipse} instance
097         */
098        public GeometricEllipse(AlgebraicEllipse ae) {
099                this(getGeometricEllipseParameters(ae));
100        }
101
102        private static double[] getGeometricEllipseParameters(AlgebraicEllipse ae) {
103                // see Eq. 19-23 at http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Ellipse.html
104                final double A = ae.A;
105                final double B = ae.B;
106                final double C = ae.C;
107                final double D = ae.D;
108                final double E = ae.E;
109                final double F = ae.F;          
110                final double d = sqr(B) - 4*A*C;
111                
112                if (d >= 0) {
113                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("B^2 - 4AC must be negative for an ellipse");
114                }
115
116                final double q = sqrt(sqr(A-C) + sqr(B));
117                final double s = 2*(A*sqr(E) + C*sqr(D) + F*sqr(B) - B*D*E - 4*A*C*F);
118                
119                double xc = (2 * C * D - B * E) / d;
120                double yc = (2 * A * E - B * D) / d;
121                double ra = sqrt(s / (d * (-A - C + q)));
122                double rb = sqrt(s / (d * (-A - C - q)));
123                double theta = 0.5 * Math.atan2(-B, C - A); // theta = -pi/2,...,+pi/2
124                
125                return (ra >= rb) ? // make sure ra >= rb (ra is the major axis)
126                        new double[] {ra, rb, xc, yc, theta} :
127                        new double[] {rb, ra, xc, yc, theta + PI/2} ;
128        }
129        
130        // ---------------------------------------
131        
132
133        /**
134         * Return a vector of parameters for this ellipse.
135         * The length of the vector and the meaning of the parameters depends
136         * on the concrete ellipse type.
137         * 
138         * @return a vector of parameters [ra, rb, xc, yc, theta]
139         */
140        public double[] getParameters() {
141                return new double[] {ra, rb, xc, yc, theta};
142        }
143        
144        public Pnt2d getCenter() {
145                return Pnt2d.from(xc, yc);
146        }
147        
148        public double getArea() {
149                return this.ra * this.rb * Math.PI;
150        }
151        
152        public double getAlgebraicDistance(Pnt2d p) {
153                return new AlgebraicEllipse(this).getAlgebraicDistance(p);
154        }
155        
156        /**
157         * Returns the ellipse point closest to the specified point.
158         * To perform this calculation for multiple points on the
159         * same ellipse use {@link OrthogonalEllipseProjector}.
160         * 
161         * @see OrthogonalEllipseProjector
162         * @param pnt some 2D point
163         * @return the closest ("contact") point on the ellipse
164         */
165        public Pnt2d getClosestPoint(Pnt2d pnt) {
166                return projector.project(pnt);
167        }
168        
169        public double[] getClosestPoint(double[] pnt) {
170                return projector.project(pnt);
171        }
172        
173        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
174
175    /**
176         * Returns the mean squared error between this ellipse 
177         * and a set of 2D points.
178         *
179         * @param points a set of sample points (usually the points used for fitting)
180         * @return the mean squared error
181         */
182        public double getMeanSquareError(Pnt2d[] points) {
183                double sum2 = 0;
184                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
185                        sum2 = sum2 + p.distanceSq(getClosestPoint(p));
186                }
187                return sum2 / points.length;
188        }
189        
190        /**
191         * Returns the closest (geometric) distance of the specified point to this ellipse.
192         * @param p some 2D point
193         * @return the distance to the closest point on the ellipse
194         */
195        @Override
196        public double getDistance(Pnt2d p) {
197                return p.distance(getClosestPoint(p));
198        }
199        
200        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
201        
202        @Override
203        public Shape getShape(double scale) {
204                return this.getOuterShape();
205        }
206        
207        @Override
208        public Shape[] getShapes(double scale) {
209                return new Shape[] {
210                                getOuterShape(),
211                                getCenterShape(scale),
212                                getAxisShape()
213                };
214        }
215        
216        private Shape getOuterShape() {
217                Ellipse2D oval = new Ellipse2D.Double(-ra, -rb, 2 * ra, 2 * rb);
218                AffineTransform trans = new AffineTransform();
219                trans.translate(xc, yc);
220                trans.rotate(theta);
221                return trans.createTransformedShape(oval);
222        }
223        
224        private Shape getCenterShape(double radius) {
225                double dxa = 2 * radius * cos(theta);   // major axis is drawn longer
226                double dya = 2 * radius * sin(theta);
227                double dxb = 1 * radius * cos(theta + PI/2);
228                double dyb = 1 * radius * sin(theta + PI/2);
229                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
230                path.moveTo(xc - dxa, yc - dya);
231                path.lineTo(xc + dxa, yc + dya);
232                path.moveTo(xc - dxb, yc - dyb);
233                path.lineTo(xc + dxb, yc + dyb);
234                return path;
235        }
236        
237        private Shape getAxisShape() {
238                double dxa = ra * cos(theta);
239                double dya = ra * sin(theta);
240                double dxb = rb * cos(theta + PI/2);
241                double dyb = rb * sin(theta + PI/2);
242                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
243                path.moveTo(xc - dxa, yc - dya);
244                path.lineTo(xc + dxa, yc + dya);
245                path.moveTo(xc - dxb, yc - dyb);
246                path.lineTo(xc + dxb, yc + dyb);
247                return path;
248        }
249        
250        @Deprecated             // used for book figures only
251        public Pnt2d getLeftAxisPoint() {
252                return Pnt2d.from(xc - ra * cos(theta), yc - ra * sin(theta));
253        }
254        
255        // -------------------------------
256        
257        public GeometricEllipse duplicate() {
258                return new GeometricEllipse(this.getParameters());
259        }
260        
261        @Override
262        public boolean equals(Object other) {
263                if (this == other) {
264                        return true;
265                }
266                if (!(other instanceof GeometricEllipse)) {
267            return false;
268        }
269                return this.equals((GeometricEllipse) other, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
270        }
271        
272        public boolean equals(GeometricEllipse other, double tolerance) {
273                return 
274                                Arithmetic.equals(xc, other.xc, tolerance) &&
275                                Arithmetic.equals(yc, other.yc, tolerance) &&
276                                Arithmetic.equals(ra, other.ra, tolerance) &&
277                                Arithmetic.equals(rb, other.rb, tolerance) &&
278                                Arithmetic.equals(Math.cos(theta), Math.cos(other.theta), tolerance) &&
279                                Arithmetic.equals(Math.sin(theta), Math.sin(other.theta), tolerance) ;
280        }
281        
282        @Override
283        public String toString() {
284                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s [ra=%.8f, rb=%.8f, xc=%.8f, yc=%.8f, theta=%.8f]", 
285                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), ra, rb, xc, yc, theta);
286        }
287
288}
